thread.title: A look at Rockets star James Harden’s best games

author: Ultimate Rockets
title: A look at Rockets star James Harden’s best games
text:
Image 1 of 11 10. Dixon’s winner at the death The Dynamo were trying to stay in the playoff race in August of 2011 when they faced Real Salt Lake at home. The Dynamo twice fell behind but found themselves level as three minutes of stoppage time began. A late crossing pass was cleared and fell to Alex Dixon at the right corner of the penalty area. Dixon dribbled past a pair of defenders and hit a left-footed shot that floated past the goalkeeper with 92:56 on the clock. The Dynamo went on to win the conference title. 10. Dixon’s winner at the death The Dynamo were trying to stay in the playoff race in August of 2011 when they faced Real Salt Lake at home. The Dynamo twice fell behind but found themselves level as three... Photo: Patric Schneider, Associated Press Image 2 of 11 9 Brian Ching testimonial match As one of the most legendary players in club history it was fitting that Brian Ching ended his career with one more multi-goal performance in front of the home fans. In December of 2013 the Dynamo hosted a testimonial match to honor Ching’s retirement. It featured players from the Dynamo’s MLS Cup title teams in 2006 and 2007. Even Landon Donovan made an appearance and played goalkeeper. Ching scored five goals to lead his team to a 6-4 victory. He subbed out in the 69th minute and got a standing ovation and cheers of “Thank you Brian.” 9 Brian Ching testimonial match As one of the most legendary players in club history it was fitting that Brian Ching ended his career with one more multi-goal performance in front of the home fans. In... Photo: Eric Christian Smith, For The Chronicle Image 3 of 11 8. Record home unbeaten streak Talent, organization and probably heat and humidity allowed the Dynamo to build a 36-match home unbeaten streak between 2011 and 2013. The streak began after a loss on June 18, 2011. It did not end until May 12, 2013. The streak included three playoff matches. 8. Record home unbeaten streak Talent, organization and probably heat and humidity allowed the Dynamo to build a 36-match home unbeaten streak between 2011 and 2013. The streak began after a loss on June 18,... Photo: Smiley N. Pool, Houston Chronicle Image 4 of 11 7. Ching stars in inaugural match If there was any question which player would become the face of the Dynamo in their formative years it was erased during their first match. Brian Ching scored four goals as Houston defeated Colorado, 5-2, at Robertson Stadium. 7. Ching stars in inaugural match If there was any question which player would become the face of the Dynamo in their formative years it was erased during their first match. Brian Ching scored four goals as... Photo: Jessica Kourkounis, For The Chronicle Image 5 of 11 6. 2013 playoffs versus New York The Dynamo went into the second leg of their Eastern Conference semifinal series seeking their first victory in New York. The teams were level on aggregate after tying 2-2 in Houston. The Red Bulls took the lead in the 23rd minute, but Brad Davis got the equalizer in the 36th minute. Omar Cummings scored the winner in the 104th minute, sending the Dynamo to the Eastern Conference final for the third year in a row. 6. 2013 playoffs versus New York The Dynamo went into the second leg of their Eastern Conference semifinal series seeking their first victory in New York. The teams were level on aggregate after tying 2-2 in... Photo: Julio Cortez, Associated Press Image 6 of 11 5. 2007 playoff comeback versus FC Dallas FC Dallas has had the upper hand in the Texas Derby in recent years, but the Dynamo dominated the competition in the early going. In the first nine matches they went 6-1-2, but the Dynamo picked up their biggest victory over Dallas in the second leg of a playoff series in 2007. Dallas scored once at home and then took an early lead in Houston for a 2-0 lead. Stuart Holden and Brian Ching scored in regulation to pull level, and then the Dynamo pulled away in extra time for a 4-2 aggregate victory. 5. 2007 playoff comeback versus FC Dallas FC Dallas has had the upper hand in the Texas Derby in recent years, but the Dynamo dominated the competition in the early going. In the first nine matches they went... Photo: Smiley N. Pool, Houston Chronicle Image 7 of 11 4. 2012 playoffs versus Sporting Kansas City One of Houston’s biggest rivals is Sporting Kansas City. The Dynamo added some bite to the rivalry when it upset Kansas City in the playoffs in 2011 and 2012. Kansas City was the top seed in the Eastern Conference both times. In the first leg of the 2012 series, the Dynamo got goals from Adam Moffat and Will Bruin. Then they held on by conceding only once in the match in Kansas City to win the series on aggregate, 2-1. 4. 2012 playoffs versus Sporting Kansas City One of Houston’s biggest rivals is Sporting Kansas City. The Dynamo added some bite to the rivalry when it upset Kansas City in the playoffs in 2011 and 2012.... Photo: JOHN SLEEZER, McClatchy-Tribune News Service Image 8 of 11 3. 2007 MLS Cup Title Just in case the league thought the Dynamo were going to be a flash in a pan, they went out and won another league championship. Houston fell behind New England in the 20th minute but got a goal and an assist from Dwayne De Rosario in the second half to win the match, 2-1. 3. 2007 MLS Cup Title Just in case the league thought the Dynamo were going to be a flash in a pan, they went out and won another league championship. Houston fell behind New England in the 20th minute but... Photo: James Nielsen Image 9 of 11 2. 2006 MLS Cup Title Talk about making a good first impression. Houston did not have to wait long to celebrate its first soccer championship. The Dynamo played to a 1-1 draw with New England after extra time. Taylor Twellman gave the Revolution the lead in the 113th minute with Brian Ching pulling the Dynamo level one minute later. The Dynamo won, 4-3, on penalties with Ching scoring the winner. 2. 2006 MLS Cup Title Talk about making a good first impression. Houston did not have to wait long to celebrate its first soccer championship. The Dynamo played to a 1-1 draw with New England after extra... Photo: Nathan Lindstrom, For The Chronicle Image 10 of 11 
1. BBVA Compass Stadium opens 
Boasting a pro soccer team is one thing for a city. Boasting a magnificent soccer-specific stadium to house that team is another. Six years after the Dynamo came to Houston they had a home to call their own. They opened the stadium on May 12, 2012 with a 1-0 victory over D.C. United on Brad Davis’ shot from distance. 
“The opening of the stadium was the most grand and the most important,” Dynamo president Chris Canetti said. “We’ll always look back at that day as a big moment in history when everything changed for our organization.” 
1. BBVA Compass Stadium opens

As the Dynamo celebrate 10 years in Houston, here's a look at 10 key moments in the franchise's history.
